publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3445 Irene McGugan: Chris Hoy Track Cycling Success—That the Parliament congratulates Scottish cyclist Chris Hoy on winning gold in the Men’s 1 km time trial at the Track Cycling World Championships, held in Copenhagen between 25 and 29 September 2002; further congratulates Chris Hoy on adding this significant and well-deserved success to his Commonwealth Games title won in Manchester in August 2002; regrets that Chris Hoy, along with other professional Scottish cyclists, is forced to further his cycling career away from Scotland owing to the lack of an adequate all-weather facility at the Meadowbank velodrome in Edinburgh, currently the only velodrome in Scotland; supports the urgent need to provide such all-weather sporting facilities for both "elite" cyclists and others interested in pursuing a healthy and active lifestyle, many of whom are young people and children, and urges the Scottish Executive and sportscotland to provide the funding necessary to the creation of these facilities.
S1M-3445 Chris Hoy Track Cycling Success (lodged on 1 October 2002) Michael Matheson*, Alex Johnstone*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-3445 Chris Hoy Track Cycling Success (lodged on 1 October 2002) Phil Gallie*, Mr Keith Harding*
